associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for developing cybersecurity workforce plans, assessments, strategies, and guidance, including cybersecurity-related staff training, education, and hiring processes. Makes adjustments in response to or in anticipation of changes to cybersecurity-related policy, technology, and staffing needs and requirements. Authors mandated workforce planning strategies to maintain compliance with legislation, regulation, and policy.
associated_work_roles.ncwf_definition: Responsible for developing cybersecurity workforce plans, assessments, strategies, and guidance, including cybersecurity-related staff training, education, and hiring processes. Makes adjustments in response to or in anticipation of changes to cybersecurity-related policy, technology, and staffing needs and requirements. Authors mandated workforce planning strategies to maintain compliance with legislation, regulation, and policy.

associated_work_roles.title: Cyber Policy and Strategy Planner
associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for developing and maintaining cybersecurity plans, strategy, and policy to support and align with organizational cybersecurity initiatives and regulatory compliance.
associated_work_roles.ncwf_definition: Responsible for developing and maintaining cybersecurity plans, strategy, and policy to support and align with organizational cybersecurity initiatives and regulatory compliance.

associated_work_roles.title: Executive Cyber Leader
associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for establishing vision and direction for an organization's cybersecurity operations and resources and their impact on digital and physical spaces. Possesses authority to make and execute decisions that impact an organization broadly, including policy approval and stakeholder engagement.
associated_work_roles.ncwf_definition: Responsible for establishing vision and direction for an organization's cybersecurity operations and resources and their impact on digital and physical spaces. Possesses authority to make and execute decisions that impact an organization broadly, including policy approval and stakeholder engagement.

associated_work_roles.title: Cyber Instructional Curriculum Developer
associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for developing, planning, coordinating, and evaluating cybersecurity awareness, training, or education content, methods, and techniques based on instructional needs and requirements.
associated_work_roles.ncwf_definition: Responsible for developing, planning, coordinating, and evaluating cybersecurity awareness, training, or education content, methods, and techniques based on instructional needs and requirements.

associated_work_roles.title: Cyber Instructor
associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for developing and conducting cybersecurity awareness, training, or education.

associated_work_roles.title: Forensics Analyst
associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for identifying, collecting, examining, and preserving digital evidence using controlled and documented analytical and investigative techniques.
associated_work_roles.ncwf_definition: Responsible for identifying, collecting, examining, and preserving digital evidence using controlled and documented analytical and investigative techniques.

associated_work_roles.title: Cyber Crime Investigator
associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for investigating cyberspace intrusion incidents and crimes. Applies tactics, techniques, and procedures for a full range of investigative tools and processes and appropriately balances the benefits of prosecution versus intelligence gathering.
associated_work_roles.ncwf_definition: Responsible for investigating cyberspace intrusion incidents and crimes. Applies tactics, techniques, and procedures for a full range of investigative tools and processes and appropriately balances the benefits of prosecution versus intelligence gathering.

associated_work_roles.title: Cyber Legal Advisor
associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for providing cybersecurity legal advice and recommendations, including monitoring related legislation and regulations.

associated_work_roles.title: Program Manager
associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for leading, coordinating, and the overall success of a defined program. Includes communicating about the program and ensuring alignment with agency or organizational priorities.
associated_work_roles.ncwf_definition: Responsible for leading, coordinating, and the overall success of a defined program. Includes communicating about the program and ensuring alignment with agency or organizational priorities.

associated_work_roles.title: IT Project Manager
associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for overseeing and directly managing technology projects. Ensures cybersecurity is built into projects to protect the organization's critical infrastructure and assets, reduce risk, and meet organizational goals. Tracks and communicates project status and demonstrates project value to the organization.

associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for planning, estimating costs, budgeting, developing, implementing, and managing product support strategies in order to field and maintain the readiness and operational capability of systems and components.

associated_work_roles.title: IT Program Auditor
associated_work_roles.definition: Responsible for conducting evaluations of technology programs or their individual components to determine compliance with published standards.
